q: Happiness is not a goal...it's a by-product of a life well lived.
h:
“Happiness is not a goal...it's a by-product of a life well lived.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.
h:
“Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
h:
“The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Everything eaten is killed. Every meal is a sacrifice.
h:
“Everything eaten is killed. Every meal is a sacrifice.” —
Adi Da Samraj

q: We must create our own world or we will die from inaction.
h:
“We must create our own world or we will die from inaction.” —
Robert Greene

q: There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.
h:
“There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.” —
Maya Angelou

q: Go and do the things you can't. That is how you get to do them.
h:
“Go and do the things you can't. That is how you get to do them.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
h:
“Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.” —
Thomas Edison

q: Successful people do what unsuccessful people are not willing to do.
h:
“Successful people do what unsuccessful people are not willing to do.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.
h:
“Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.” —
Richard Bach

q: We learn by pushing ourselves and finding what really lies at the outer reaches of our abilities.
h:
“We learn by pushing ourselves and finding what really lies at the outer reaches of our abilities.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: When at last you are come to the ocean of happiness, do not go back thirsty.
h:
“When at last you are come to the ocean of happiness, do not go back thirsty.” —
Kabir

q: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
h:
“The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate. ” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: To be fully alive, fully human, and completely awake is to be continually thrown out of the nest.
h:
“To be fully alive, fully human, and completely awake is to be continually thrown out of the nest.” —
Pema Chodron

q: Once a decision was made, I didn't worry about it afterward.
h:
“Once a decision was made, I didn't worry about it afterward.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: We know nothing of tomorrow, our business is to be good and happy today.
h:
“We know nothing of tomorrow, our business is to be good and happy today.” —
Sydney Smith

q: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.
h:
“There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.” —
Colin Powell

q: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
h:
“It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.” —
Aristotle

q: You must be willing to do what others won't do, to have what others won't have.
h:
“You must be willing to do what others won't do, to have what others won't have.” —
Les Brown

q: Everything is in your own heart.
h:
“Everything is in your own heart.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: Every adversity, every failure, every heartbreak, carries with it the seed of an equal or greater benefit.
h:
“Every adversity, every failure, every heartbreak, carries with it the seed of an equal or greater benefit.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: He who leaves the game wins it.
h:
“He who leaves the game wins it.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: Your only limitations are those you set up in your mind or permit others to set up for you.
h:
“Your only limitations are those you set up in your mind or permit others to set up for you.” —
Og Mandino

q: Never regret your past. Rather, embrace it as the teacher that it is.
h:
“Never regret your past. Rather, embrace it as the teacher that it is.” —
Robin Sharma

q: The more tranquil a man becomes, the greater is his success, his influence, his power for good. Calmness of mind is one of the beautiful jewels of wisdom.
h:
“The more tranquil a man becomes, the greater is his success, his influence, his power for good. Calmness of mind is one of the beautiful jewels of wisdom.” —
James Allen

q: Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get.
h:
“Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get.” —
W.P. Kinsella

q: Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind.
h:
“Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: The first principle of success is desire.
h:
“The first principle of success is desire.” —
Robert Collier

q: If your mind is empty, it is always ready for anything, it is open to everything.
h:
“If your mind is empty, it is always ready for anything, it is open to everything.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

q: Getting over a painful experience is much like crossing monkey bars. You have to let go at some point in order to move forward.
h:
“Getting over a painful experience is much like crossing monkey bars. You have to let go at some point in order to move forward.” —
Unknown

q: Without struggle, no progress and no result. Every breaking of habit produces a change in the machine.
h:
“Without struggle, no progress and no result. Every breaking of habit produces a change in the machine.” —
G.I. Gurdjieff

q: I admire those who do good and expect nothing in return.
h:
“I admire those who do good and expect nothing in return.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Confidence is the greatest friend.
h:
“Confidence is the greatest friend.” —
Lao Tzu

q: All happiness depends on courage and work.
h:
“All happiness depends on courage and work.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts; therefore guard accordingly.
h:
“The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts; therefore guard accordingly.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: No problem can be solved from the same level of consciousness that created it.
h:
“No problem can be solved from the same level of consciousness that created it.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Success is doing what you want to do, when you want, where you want, with whom you want, as much as you want.
h:
“Success is doing what you want to do, when you want, where you want, with whom you want, as much as you want.” —
Tony Robbins

q: You are the only problem you will ever have and you are the only solution.
h:
“You are the only problem you will ever have and you are the only solution.” —
Bob Proctor

q: You cannot find peace avoiding life.
h:
“You cannot find peace avoiding life.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: There is always risk, so learn to manage risk instead of avoiding it.
h:
“There is always risk, so learn to manage risk instead of avoiding it.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: A bird does not sing because it has an answer. It sings because it has a song.
h:
“A bird does not sing because it has an answer. It sings because it has a song.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: A fall into a ditch makes you wiser.
h:
“A fall into a ditch makes you wiser.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: The fear of death is more to be feared, than death itself.
h:
“The fear of death is more to be feared, than death itself.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: We ourselves feel that what we are doing is just a drop in the ocean. But the ocean would be less because of that missing drop.
h:
“We ourselves feel that what we are doing is just a drop in the ocean. But the ocean would be less because of that missing drop.” —
Mother Teresa

q: He who wishes to be obeyed must know how to command.
h:
“He who wishes to be obeyed must know how to command.” —
Niccolo Machiavelli

q: What's the point in being smart enough to read, if everything you read makes you dumb?
h:
“What's the point in being smart enough to read, if everything you read makes you dumb?” —
C. Sean McGee

q: Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.
h:
“Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: He who possesses most must be most afraid of loss.
h:
“He who possesses most must be most afraid of loss.” —
Leonardo da Vinci

q: Many answers to what you seek don't lie 'out there'. If you look inwards, you'll find the answer has been in you all along.
h:
“Many answers to what you seek don't lie 'out there'. If you look inwards, you'll find the answer has been in you all along.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Be curious, not judgmental.
h:
“Be curious, not judgmental.” —
Walt Whitman
